Detailed Description

3D Viewport for displaying and manipulating 3D objects

See also:
DzViewport::get3DViewport()

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Dz3DViewport::AnchorLocation

The possible locations for the view tool bar.

Enumerator:
AnchorTopLeft 

Top Left corner of the viewport.

AnchorTopRight 

Top Right corner of the viewport.

AnchorBottomLeft 

Bottom Left corner of the viewport.

AnchorBottomRight 

Bottom Right corner of the viewport.

enum Dz3DViewport::FloorStyle

The styles of the floor that is drawn in the viewport.

Enumerator:
NoFloor 

No floor is drawn

WireFloor 

A grid floor is drawn

SolidFloor 

A solid floor is drawn

enum Dz3DViewport::ShadeStyle

A list of shading styles for rendering scene objects in OpenGL. These coincide with the ShadeStyle types in DzDrawStyle, and are provided here for scriptability.

Enumerator:
WireBox 

Draws unlit wireframe bounding boxes

SolidBox 

Draws smooth-shaded bounding boxes

Wireframe 

Draws unlit wireframes

LitWireframe 

Draws lit wireframes

HiddenLine 

Draws unlit wireframes, front geometry facing only

WireShaded 

Draws lit smooth shaded objects with wireframes imposed

SmoothShaded 

Draws lit smooth shaded objects

WireTextured 

Draws lit smooth shaded objects with any texture/transparency maps applied and wireframes imposed

Textured 

Draws lit smooth shaded objects with any texture/transparency maps applied

enum Dz3DViewport::ToolBarMode

The different toolbar modes for the interface.

Enumerator:
DockedToolBar 

Docked toolbar mode for the viewport.

CameraCubeHUD 

Used the camera cube HUD instead of toolbar.

void Dz3DViewport::aimCamera (  )  [slot]

Aim the viewport's camera at the primary selection in the scene. If the scene does not have a primary selection this function does nothing.

void Dz3DViewport::aimCameraAtBox ( const DzBox3 &  box  )  [slot]
Parameters:
box the box to aim the viewport's camera at. Aim the viewport's camera at the given box. If the box is invalid this function does nothing.
void Dz3DViewport::aimCameraAtPrimaryNode (  )  [slot]

Aim the viewport's camera at the primary selection in the scene. If the scene does not have a primary selection this function does nothing.

void Dz3DViewport::appendHoverCursor ( QCursor  cursor  )  [slot]

This method appends the given cursor to this viewport's internal stack of cursors. It should be called by DzViewTool in the DzViewTool::mouseOver() method if they want to provide visual feedback that the mouse is currently hovering over a clickable portion of the tool.h

Parameters:
cursor The cursor to append for providing visual feedback

onOff The new state of the aspect frame on property.

QImage Dz3DViewport::captureImage (  )  [slot]

Captures the current contents from the OpenGL frame buffer as an image.

Returns:
A snap shot of the OpenGL frame buffer.
Example:
    QImage          img;
    DzImageMgr      *imageMgr = dzApp->getImageMgr();
    DzMainWindow    *mw = dzApp->getInterface();

    if( mw ){
        // capture the contents of the active viewport
        img = mw->getViewportMgr()->getActiveViewport()->get3DViewport()->captureImage();

        // save the image to a file
        imageMgr->saveImage( dzApp->getDocumentsPath() + "/viewport.png", img );
    }
Dz3DViewport::contextMenuAboutToShow ( DzMenu *  menu,
QPoint  pos 
) [signal]

Emitted when the viewport is about to display a context menu. Other objects can connect to this signal to add custom items to the menu that is displayed to the user. Only connect to this signal if you only want to affect this particular viewport - otherwise connect to DzViewportMgr::contextMenuAboutToShow().

Parameters:
menu The menu that will be displayed
pos The position in the viewport where the context menu was triggered.

Returns:

setAspectOn()
bool Dz3DViewport::getAxesOn (  )  const
Returns:
The center Axes display status
Example:
    DzMainWindow    *mw = dzApp->getInterface();
    Dz3DViewport    *view;

    if( mw ){
        // if the axes are on for the viewport, turn the floor off, otherwise,
        // turn the floor on in wireframe mode.
        view = mw->getViewportMgr()->getActiveViewport()->get3DViewport();
        if( view->getAxesOn() )
            view->setFloorStyle( Dz3DViewport::NoFloor );
        else
            view->setFloorStyle( Dz3DViewport::WireFloor );
    }
See also:
setAxesOn()
QColor Dz3DViewport::getBackground (  )  const
Returns:
The current background color for the viewport.
Example:
    QColor          bgColor;
    DzMainWindow    *mw = dzApp->getInterface();
    Dz3DViewport    *view;

    if( mw ){
        // lighten the background color for the active viewport
        view = mw->getViewportMgr()->getActiveViewport()->get3DViewport();
        bgColor = view->getBackgroundColor();
        view->setBackgroundColor( bgColor.light() );
    }
See also:
setBackground()
DzCamera * Dz3DViewport::getCamera (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The currently active camera for this viewport.
Example:
    DzMainWindow    *mw = dzApp->getInterface();

    // reset the camera being used by the active viewport
    if( mw )
        mw->getViewportMgr()->getActiveViewport()->get3DViewport()->getCamera()->reset();
See also:
setCamera()
DzDrawStyle * Dz3DViewport::getDrawStyle (  ) 

Get the current draw style for the viewport.

Example:
    int             i, n;
    DzDrawStyle     *style;
    DzMainWindow    *mw = dzApp->getInterface();
    DzViewportMgr   *mgr;

    if( mw ){
        mgr = mw->getViewportMgr();

        // get the draw style for the active viewport
        style = mgr->getActiveViewport()->get3DViewport()->getDrawStyle();

        // set all the viewports to use the same style
        n = mgr->getNumViewports();
        for( i = 0; i < n; i++ )
            mgr->getViewport( i )->get3DViewport()->setDrawStyle( style );
    }
Dz3DViewport::FloorStyle Dz3DViewport::getFloorStyle (  )  const
Returns:
The current floor drawing style
Example:
    int                         i, n;
    Dz3DViewport::FloorStyle    floor;
    DzMainWindow                *mw = dzApp->getInterface();
    DzViewportMgr               *mgr;

    if( mw ){
        mgr = mw->getViewportMgr();

        // get the floor style for the active viewport
        floor = mgr->getActiveViewport()->get3DViewport()->getFloorStyle();

        // set all the viewports to use the same floor style
        n = mgr->getNumViewports();
        for( i = 0; i < n; i++ )
            mgr->getViewport( i )->get3DViewport()->setFloorStyle( floor );
    }
See also:
setFloorStyle()

Dz3DViewport::ShadeStyle Dz3DViewport::getShadeStyle (  )  const
Returns:
The current geometry shading style
Example:
    int                         i, n;
    Dz3DViewport::ShadeStyle    shade;
    DzMainWindow                *mw = dzApp->getInterface();
    DzViewportMgr               *mgr;

    if( mw ){
        mgr = mw->getViewportMgr();

        // get the shading style for the active viewport
        shade = mgr->getActiveViewport()->get3DViewport()->getShadeStyle();

        // set all the viewports to use the same shading style
        n = mgr->getNumViewports();
        for( i = 0; i < n; i++ )
            mgr->getViewport( i )->get3DViewport()->setShadeStyle( shade );
    }

bool Dz3DViewport::hardwareRender ( DzRenderHandler *  handler  )  const [virtual, slot]

Performs a hardware assisted OpenGL render in this viewport with the given settings.

Parameters:

Returns:
true if the scene was rendered successfully, otherwise false.
bool Dz3DViewport::isCurrent (  )  const

Checks if the OpenGL context of the viewport is the current OpenGL rendering context.

Returns:
true if the viewport context is the current context. Otherwise, false.
Example:
    DzMainWindow    *mw = dzApp->getInterface();
    DzViewportMgr   *mgr = mw->getViewportMgr();
    DzViewport      *view;
    int             i, numFrames = mgr->getNumViewports();

    for( i = 0; i < numFrames; i++ ){
        view = mgr->getViewport( i );
        if( view->get3DViewport()->isCurrent() ){
            // do something...
        }
    }
See also:
getDrawStyle()
bool Dz3DViewport::isHardwareRenderable (  )  const [virtual, slot]
Returns:
true if this viewport supports rendering via OpenGL.

void Dz3DViewport::onHide (  ) 

Called by the framework. This is necessary because Qt does not correctly handle show events when the application window gets minimized.

See also:
onShow()

Called by the framework. This is necessary because Qt does not correctly handle show events when the application window gets minimized.

void Dz3DViewport::pickNodes ( const QPolygonF &  area,
DzNodeList &  nodes,
bool  useSelectionMaps = true 
) [slot]

Called by the framework when the OpenGL options have been changed, and the viewport. needs to update.

int Dz3DViewport::pickOnFacet ( const QPoint &  pnt,
DzNode **  facetNode = NULL 
) [slot]

Performs a facet picking operation on the scene through this viewport.

Parameters:
pnt The pixel coordinates of the point in the viewport to pick on.
node If not NULL, set to the node that owns the facet.
Returns:
The index of the facet that was hit, or -1 if none.
int Dz3DViewport::pickOnGizmo ( const QPoint &  pnt  )  [slot]

Performs a gizmo picking operation through this viewport. View tools (see DzViewTool) can draw a 'gizmo' in the viewport for the user to interact with. The tool can assign different parts of the gizmo to specific indices, so as to tell what part of the gizmo was clicked by the user.

Parameters:
pnt The point in the viewport to pick on.
Returns:
The gizmo index that was hit, 0 if none.
DzMaterial * Dz3DViewport::pickOnMaterial ( const QPoint &  pnt  )  [slot]

Performs a material picking operation on the scene through this viewport. This example shows the mousePress() implementation from a view tool (see DzViewTool) that sets the color of any material that the user clicks in the viewport.

Example:
    bool MyViewTool::mousePress( Dz3DViewport *view, QMouseEvent *e ,DzViewportMgr::ViewMouseModifier modifier)
    {
        DzMaterial  *mat;

        // find out what material the user clicked on
        mat = view->pickOnMaterial( e->pos() );

        // if the user clicked on a material, set its color to blue
        if( mat )
            mat->setDiffuseColor( QColor( 0, 0, 255 ) );

        return false;
    }
Parameters:
pnt The pixel coordinates of the point in the viewport to pick on.
Returns:
The material that was hit, if any.
DzNode * Dz3DViewport::pickOnNode ( const QPoint &  pnt,
bool  useSelectionMaps = true,
DzGeometryRegion **  region = NULL 
) [slot]

Performs a node picking operation on the scene through this viewport. View tools (see DzViewTool) will commonly use this function to determine what node (if any) that the user clicks on. This example shows the mousePress() implementation from a view tool that selects the node that the user clicks in the viewport.

Example:
    bool MyViewTool::mousePress( Dz3DViewport *view, QMouseEvent *e ,DzViewportMgr::ViewMouseModifier modifier)
    {
        DzNode      *node;

        // clear all the currently selected nodes in the scene
        dzScene->selectAllNodes( false );

        // find out what node the user clicked on
        node = view->pickOnNode( e->pos() );

        // if the user clicked on a node, select it
        if( node )
            node->select( true );

        return false;
    }
Parameters:
pnt The pixel coordinates of the point in the viewport to pick on.
Returns:
The node that was hit, if any.
bool Dz3DViewport::renderThumbnail ( DzRenderHandler *  handler  )  const [virtual, slot]

Performs a quick render of the scene suitable for a thumbnail image.

Parameters:
handler The render handler for the rendering operation.
Returns:
true if the scene was successfully rendered, otherwise, false.
void Dz3DViewport::resetCamera (  )  [slot]

Reset the viewport's camera to its default state.

void Dz3DViewport::setAspectOn ( bool  onOff  ) 

Sets the aspect ratio rectangle display on/off.

Parameters:
onOff If true, the aspect ratio for the current render settings will be displayed, if false, the aspect ratio will be hidden.
Example:
    DzMainWindow    *mw = dzApp->getInterface();

    // turn off the display of the aspect rect in the active viewport
    if( mw )
        mw->getViewportMgr()->getActiveViewport()->get3DViewport()->setAspectOn( false );
See also:
getAspectOn()

    // turn off the display of the axes in the active viewport
    if( mw )
        mw->getViewportMgr()->getActiveViewport()->get3DViewport()->setAxesOn( false );

void Dz3DViewport::setBackground ( const QColor &  color  ) 

Sets the current background color for the viewport.

Parameters:
color The new background color for the viewport.
Example:
    int             i, n;
    QColor          black( 0, 0, 0 );
    DzMainWindow    *mw = dzApp->getInterface();
    DzViewportMgr   *mgr;

    if( mw ){
        // set all the viewports in the interface to have a black background
        mgr = mw->getViewportMgr();
        n = mgr->getNumViewports();
        for( i = 0; i < n; i++ )
            mgr->getViewport( i )->get3DViewport()->setBackground( black );
    }
See also:
getBackground()
void Dz3DViewport::setCamera ( DzCamera *  cam  )  [slot]

Set the camera for the view. The pointer passed in must be a camera in the scene, or one of the view cameras from DzViewportMgr.

Parameters:
cam The camera to use for viewing in the viewport.
Example:
    DzCamera        *cam;
    DzMainWindow    *mw = dzApp->getInterface();

    // create a new camera
    cam = new DzBasicCamera;
    cam->setName( "Test Camera" );

    // add the camera to the scene
    scene->addNode( cam );

    // set the active viewport to view through the new camera
    if( mw )
        mw->getViewportMgr()->getActiveViewport()->get3DViewport()->setCamera( cam );
See also:
getCamera()
void Dz3DViewport::setCamera ( const QString &  cam  )  [slot]

Set the camera for the view. If a matching camera is not found, this function does nothing.

Parameters:
cam The name (not label) of a view camera, or a scene camera.
void Dz3DViewport::setDrawStyle ( DzDrawStyle *  style  ) 

Set the draw style for the viewport. DzDrawStyle objects are ref counted, so the viewport refs the style when it is set, and unrefs it when it is no longer using the style. The draw style will then delete itself when its ref count reaches zero.

Parameters:
style The new draw style for the viewport.
Example:
    // change the active viewport's draw style to a wireframe mode
    DzMainWindow    *mw = dzApp->getInterface();

    if( mw )
        mw->getViewportMgr()->getActiveViewport()->get3DViewport()->setDrawStyle( new DzWireFrameStyle );
See also:
getDrawStyle()
void Dz3DViewport::setFloorStyle ( FloorStyle  style  ) 

Sets the current floor style

Parameters:
style The new floor style for the viewport.
Example:
    DzMainWindow    *mw = dzApp->getInterface();

    // set the active viewport to use the solid floor style
    if( mw )
        mw->getViewportMgr()->getActiveViewport()->get3DViewport()->setFloorStyle( Dz3DViewport::SolidFloor );
See also:
getFloorStyle()
void Dz3DViewport::setPoseToolOn ( bool  onOff  ) 

Sets whether or not to display the pose tool in this viewport.

Parameters:
onOff If true, the pose tool is displayed, if false, the pose tool is hidden.
void Dz3DViewport::setShadeStyle ( ShadeStyle  style  ) 

Sets the current geometry shading style. This is mainly provided for scriptability and provides the same function as setDrawStyle(), only uses the enumerated style to determine what kind of DzDrawStyle to create.

Parameters:
style The new shading style for the viewport.
Example:
    DzMainWindow    *mw = dzApp->getInterface();

    // change the active viewport's draw style to a wireframe mode
    if( mw )
        mw->getViewportMgr()->getActiveViewport()->get3DViewport()->setShadeStyle( Dz3DViewport::Wireframe );
Would have the same effect as: 
    DzMainWindow    *mw = dzApp->getInterface();

    // change the active viewport's draw style to a wireframe mode
    if( mw )
        mw->getViewportMgr()->getActiveViewport()->get3DViewport()->setDrawStyle( new DzWireFrameStyle );
See also:
getShadeStyle()
void Dz3DViewport::setToolBarMode ( ToolBarMode  mode  ) 

Sets the current floor style

Parameters:
mode The new toolbar mode for the viewport.
void Dz3DViewport::setToolTipText ( const QString &  text = QString::null  ) 

Set the current tool tip text for the viewport. Plug-in classes, such as view tools, can use this function to change the tool tip for the viewport when the mouse is over a particular item. This example shows the mouseOver() implementation from a view tool that updates the tool tip with the name of the node that the mouse is over.

Parameters:
text The text for the viewport's tool tip.
Example:
    bool MyViewTool::mouseOver( Dz3DViewport *view, QMouseEvent *e ,DzViewportMgr::ViewMouseModifier modifier)
    {
        DzNode *node;

        // find out what node the mouse is over
        node = view->pickOnNode( e->pos() );

        // if the mouse is over a node, set the tool tip text to the label for the node,
        // if the mouse is not over a node, clear the tool tip text
        if( node )
            view->setToolTipText( node->getLabel() );
        else
            view->setToolTipText();

        return false;
    }
Dz3DViewport * Dz3DViewport::sharedWidget (  )  [static]
Returns:
A pointer to the first viewport created. This is the context which all the other contexts share lists with. This will return NULL if no viewports have been created or if all the viewports have been destroyed.
Dz3DViewport::toolBarDocked ( bool  onOff  )  [signal]

Emitted when the view tool bar is docked or undocked

Parameters:
onOff true if the view tool bar is docked, false if it is undocked.
Dz3DViewport::viewChanged (  )  [signal]

Transmitted when the area this viewport displays has changed.
